text: Python variables as keys to dict
Is there an easier way to do this in Python (2.7)?
: Note: This isn't anything fancy, like putting all local variables into a dictionary.
Just the ones I specify in a list.

code:
apple = 1
banana = 'f'
carrot = 3
fruitdict = {}

# I want to set the key equal to variable name, and value equal to variable value
# is there a more Pythonic way to get {'apple': 1, 'banana': 'f', 'carrot': 3}?

for x in [apple, banana, carrot]:
    fruitdict[x] = x # (Won't work)

text: Edit: the number assignments were meaningless...changing them.
